articles.author: Firdia Lisnawati | AP
articles.title: Indonesia sentences 2 Australians to up to a year for drugs
articles.description: A court on Indonesia's tourist island of Bali has sentenced two Australian men to nine and 12 months in jail for possessing cocaine
articles.content:
A three-member panel of judges at the Denpasar District Court found Cabantog and Van Iersel guilty of possessing and using a Category 1 drug.
Police initially said that Cabantog, 36, who was described as a hospitality consultant, was well known for circulati… [+877 chars]

articles.author: Joanna Slater, Niha Masih
articles.title: Masked assailants attack students at prestigious Indian university in New Delhi
articles.description: The mob shouted a slogan associated with India's ruling party as it stormed the campus.
articles.content: The incident comes at a moment of high political tension in India, where hundreds of thousands of people including many students have participated in protests against a controversial citizenship law passed last month. The law creates an expedited path to citi… [+4761 chars]

articles.author: Associated Press
articles.title: German police kill man who approached them with knife
articles.description: Police in western Germany say they shot and killed a 37-year-old man who approached them with a knife
articles.content:
As the man came toward the officers, they saw that he had a knife in his other hand and did not stop despite several orders to do so. A 27-year-old police officer then fatally shot him, dpa said.
Local media reported that the man shouted Allahu Akbar, or God… [+283 chars]

articles.author: Associated Press
articles.title: Fire at hospice in Poland kills 4 patients; others hurt
articles.description: Four patients at a hospice in Poland have died in a fire at the facility possibly caused by a worker's cigarette
articles.content:
WARSAW, Poland A fire broke out at a hospice in Poland on Monday, killing four people and hospitalizing 21 others, Polish media reported.
The four dead were all patients at the hospice in Chojnice, a town in northern Poland, said Marian Hinca, a spokesman fo… [+163 chars]

articles.author: Associated Press
articles.title: The Latest: Iran's supreme leader prays over slain general
articles.description: Iran's Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei has prayed over the caskets of the top Iranian general and others slain in a U.S. airstrike near the Baghdad airport last week
articles.content:
The generals successor, Easmail Ghaani stood near his side, as did Iranian President Hassan Rouhani and other top leaders in the Islamic Republic.
Khamenei wept at one point during the traditional Muslim prayers for the dead. The crowd and others wailed. Aft… [+751 chars]

articles.author: Associated Press
articles.title: Attackers beat protesting students at Indian university
articles.description: Masked assailants have beaten students and teachers with sticks on the campus of a prestigious university in India's capital
articles.content:
Most of the injured were treated at a hospital for cuts and bruises, said Aarti Vij, a spokeswoman at the All India Institute of Medical Sciences.
New Delhi Police Commissioner Amulya Patnaik said the incident was a clash between rival student groups.
Oppos… [+2150 chars]
